agenda_analysis.agenda_title: Overview of NSE Circular on ST-ASM
agenda_analysis.analysis_content:
#### **Summary of Discussion**
> The meeting focused on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) circulars related to the Short-Term Additional Surveillance Measure (ST-ASM). It was discussed that certain securities, as listed in Annexure I, have been included under ST-ASM Stage I based on market surveillance criteria. The key surveillance action highlighted was a margin requirement of 50 or existing margin, whichever is higher, capped at 100. This applicability was effective from December 18, 2025, and applied to all open positions as on December 17, 2025, and new positions created thereafter.

#### **Key Evidence**
> - The securities included under ST-ASM Stage I are listed in Annexure I of the NSE circular (Source: SUPPORTING)
> - The applicable rate of margin is 50 or existing margin, whichever is higher, with a maximum cap of 100 (Source: SUPPORTING)
> - The effective date for this applicability is December 18, 2025 (Source: SUPPORTING and AGENDA)

#### **Decisions Taken**
> - It was decided to ensure timely implementation of revised margin requirements as per NSE guidelines (Source: MOM)
> - The need for internal system readiness, risk monitoring, and proactive client communication was acknowledged (Source: MOM)
> - It was agreed upon to communicate the impact of ST-ASM to relevant stakeholders and clients (Source: MOM)
> - Continuous monitoring of securities placed under ST-ASM will be carried out by the Surveillance and Risk teams (Source: ATR)

#### **Action Steps**
> - The Compliance team has reviewed and noted the relevant NSE circulars on ST-ASM (Source: ATR)
> - The Risk Management and IT teams have been instructed to implement the revised margin requirements (Source: ATR)
> - Necessary system changes are being initiated to ensure the revised margins are applied (Source: ATR)
> - The Risk Management team is identifying and assessing the impact on affected securities and client positions (Source: ATR)
> - The Operations and Client Servicing teams have been instructed to prepare and circulate client communications informing them about the applicability and impact of ST-ASM provisions (Source: ATR)
> - Continuous monitoring of securities placed under ST-ASM will be carried out by the Surveillance and Risk teams in line with NSE guidelines and other prevailing surveillance measures (Source: ATR)

#### **Summary of Discussion**
> The meeting discussed the applicability of Short-Term Additional Surveillance Measure (ST-ASM) as per the latest NSE circulars, effective from December 18, 2025. It was noted that certain securities listed in Annexure I have been included under ST-ASM Stage I based on market surveillance criteria. The key surveillance action highlighted was a margin requirement of 50 or existing margin, whichever is higher, capped at 100. This applies to all open positions as on December 17, 2025, and new positions created from December 18, 2025. The team acknowledged that the ASM framework operates in conjunction with other existing surveillance measures imposed by the Exchange. It was clarified that inclusion under ASM is purely surveillance-based and does not indicate any adverse view on the company concerned or entity. The need for internal system readiness, risk monitoring, and proactive client communication was emphasized.
